intro: Cabralea humilis, commonly known as the Mexican coffee tree, is a small evergreen tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Cabralea humilis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests.
